senses.de: Things that are very different from each other.
senses.ex: Their styles of painting are disparate.

Tips.title: Not Interchangeable
Tips.description: Use 'disparate' to emphasize strong difference, not for things that are slightly different.
Tips.example: The twins had disparate interests: one loved ballet, the other astrophysics.

Tips.title: No Negative Bias
Tips.description: 'Disparate' describes difference without suggesting one is better or worse.
Tips.example: Despite their disparate social backgrounds, they treated each other as equals.

Tips.title: Combine Harmoniously
Tips.description: 'Disparate' elements can be brought together in a way that is interesting or attractive.
Tips.example: The festival celebrated the city's culture with music and food from disparate traditions.

Contrast.wordDefinition:
Contrast means to compare two things that are different from each other in order to show the differences. For example, when we say "contrast the two paintings," we are looking for differences between the two paintings.

Contrast is used when we want to compare two things that are different, while disparate is used when we want to describe things that are completely different and have no connection.

Different.wordDefinition:
Different refers to something that is not the same as another thing or that is distinct in nature. For example, "These two apples are different colors".

Disparate refers to things that are fundamentally different, often in a way that makes them difficult to compare or connect.

Different describes things that may have similarities but also noticeable distinctions, while disparate describes things that are so fundamentally different that they cannot be compared.

Dissimilar.wordDefinition:
The words disparate and dissimilar both mean different, but they are used in slightly different situations.

Dissimilar, on the other hand, describes things that share some commonalities but are still fundamentally different. For example, "though their hair colors are dissimilar, both sisters have the same nose shape," meaning that the sisters share a feature but are still distinct from each other in some way.

Disparate is used when there is no connection between two things, while dissimilar is used when there are some similarities but the things are still different.

Diverse.wordDefinition:
Diverse means things that are different from each other but can still be compared with each other. For example, different types of fruits are diverse.

Disparate refers to two things that have no similarities, while diverse refers to things that are different but still have some similarities.

Equal.wordDefinition:
Equal refers to things that are identical or have the same value. It's used to describe things that have equivalence or balance.

For example, "All students in the class have an equal chance to participate in the science fair."

Disparate means different while equal means the same.

Incompatible.wordDefinition:
Incompatible means two things that cannot work together, such as oil and water. They cannot mix because they are incompatible with each other.

If you want to compare two things that are different, you can use the word disparate. But if you mean that two things cannot work together, you can use the word incompatible.

Inconsistent.wordDefinition:
Disparate refers to things that are different in nature or kind, while inconsistent refers to things that are not compatible or don't match up.

If you were comparing two stories that were supposed to have the same characters and plot but had plot holes and major differences, you might say they are inconsistent because they don't match up or make sense together.

Disparate refers to differences in nature or kind, while inconsistent refers to things that are not compatible or don't match up.

Oppose.wordDefinition:
Oppose means to go against or resist something.

It is used when someone or something is taking a stand against or trying to stop another thing. For example, "The students strongly oppose the new dress code policy.".

To summarize, disparate means different, while oppose means to resist or go against.

Vary.wordDefinition:
Vary means "to differ or change in some way" and is used when referring to things that have some degree of similarity but differ in some way, such as "varying opinions" or "varied weather patterns."

In simpler terms, disparate is used when talking about things that are fundamentally different and cannot be compared, while vary is used when talking about things that have some degree of similarity but differ in some way.

quotes.Text: The truth is I'm not actually an expert programmer! I really don't consider myself to be an expert at anything. For me, it's more about having a well-rounded and broad horizon. I think that's where a lot of the more interesting things come from - mashing up completely disparate aspects of life to create something new and original.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Aaron Koblin

quotes.Text: The idea that humanity is divided into these separate and distinct and disparate groups with clear boundaries has been disproven by science a long time ago, decades ago. Humanity really is more of a continuum, and that people belong on the same continuum and there are no clear breaks between these so-called races.
quotes.Title: Filipino Author
quotes.Name: Alex Tizon

quotes.Text: At any given moment, we each face a barrage of obligations, often disparate and distinct from what we thought would happen when we woke up. From the tragic to the common to the extraordinary, life refuses to be divvied up into careful slices of time. No technology can manage to overcome the realities of reality.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Stacey Abrams

quotes.Text: The public in many countries is understandably concerned by the commitment of substantial government resources to aid the financial industry when other industries receive little or no assistance. This disparate treatment, unappealing as it is, appears unavoidable.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Ben Bernanke

quotes.Text: It's really interesting to me how all of us can experience the exact same event, and yet come away with wildly disparate interpretations of what happened. We each have totally different ideas of what was said, what was intended, and what really took place.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Marya Hornbacher

quotes.Text: In disciplines as disparate as baseball, financial services, trucking and retail, people are realizing the power of data to help make better decisions.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Paul DePodesta

quotes.Text: Actors usually respond to minor aspects of their own character or things that even feel disparate from themselves.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jeff Perry

quotes.Text: Even the contemporary horror authors who have seriously influenced me are a disparate bunch.
quotes.Title: Canadian Author
quotes.Name: Stephen R. George

quotes.Text: The films that influenced me were so disparate that there's almost no pattern.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: James Cameron

quotes.Text: It was really important to me to explore how disparate people are connected.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Natasha Rothwell
